citing_paper_authors: Masatoshi, Tsuchiya | Takao, Shime | Toshihiro, Takagi | Takehito, Utsuro | Kiyotaka, Uchimoto | Suguru, Matsuyoshi | Satoshi, Sato | Seiichi, Nakagawa
raw_text: We employ the technique of Support Vector Machines (SVMs) (Vapnik, 1998) as the machine learning technique, which has been successfully applied to various natural language processing tasks including chunking tasks such as phrase chunking (Kudo and Matsumoto, 2001) and named entity chunking (Mayfield et al, 2003) .In the preliminary experimental evaluation, we focus on 52 expressions that have balanced distribution of their usages in the newspaper text corpus and are among the most difficult ones in terms of their identification in a text
clean_text: We employ the technique of Support Vector Machines (SVMs) (Vapnik, 1998) as the machine learning technique, which has been successfully applied to various natural language processing tasks including chunking tasks such as phrase chunking (Kudo and Matsumoto, 2001) and named entity chunking (Mayfield et al, 2003).
